topics.title: Cold open: promotion denial, leadership, meetings tease
topics.summary: Quick preview of the episode’s key advice: a script for telling someone they’re not getting promoted, why leaders shouldn’t optimize for employee happiness, and a teaser about ending meetings effectively.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Alisa Cohn’s coaching background and previews what listeners will learn: actionable scripts for hard conversations, meeting wrap-up questions, leadership mindset, and founder alignment topics.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Eppo (experimentation/A-B testing) and Rippling (HR/IT/payroll platform), including product benefits and listener offers.

topics.title: Why difficult conversations feel so hard
topics.summary: Lenny shares his dread of hard conversations; Alisa coaches on identifying what’s truly scary (e.g., upsetting others) and reframing discomfort as a path to growth and better outcomes.

topics.title: Common hard conversation types and mindset
topics.summary: They enumerate typical scenarios (performance feedback, promotions, terminations) and emphasize getting your intent and mindset right: feedback is to help someone succeed, not to vent or punish.

topics.title: Script for performance feedback with peers
topics.summary: Alisa provides a practical script for addressing missed deadlines and poor coordination, focusing on neutral framing, shared expectations, and leaving the meeting with a clear plan.

topics.title: When feedback is your observation, not hearsay
topics.summary: They adapt the script for cases where the manager is the primary observer (e.g., writing quality), stressing observable facts, specific expectations, and concrete improvement supports.

topics.title: Handling defensiveness and emotional reactions
topics.summary: Alisa shares language to pause a heated exchange, restate caring intent, and decide whether to continue now or revisit later—so the manager doesn’t get pulled into an argument.

topics.title: Script for not granting a promotion
topics.summary: Alisa outlines how to deliver a promotion ‘no’ early and clearly, explain decision criteria, and provide hope and a development path; they also cover how to respond to disagreement.

topics.title: Pre-termination clarity: the final warning script
topics.summary: Before firing, Alisa recommends a crystal-clear ‘deal breaker’ conversation with a timeline and consequences, ensuring expectations are explicit and termination is not a surprise.

topics.title: The termination conversation and logistics handoff
topics.summary: Alisa gives a concise firing script (with HR/legal caveats): reference prior warnings, state the decision plainly, and transition to HR for next steps while staying respectful.

topics.title: Positive feedback as a leadership skill
topics.summary: They argue that praise should be as specific and behavior-linked as constructive feedback, building morale, clarity, and a reservoir of trust that makes hard conversations easier later.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Liveblocks, highlighting ready-made collaborative product features (comments, multiplayer, copilot-like experiences) and a signup link.

topics.title: Leaders shouldn’t optimize for employee happiness
topics.summary: Alisa explains why founders/managers often over-index on keeping people happy, and why the real job is driving results through clarity, accountability, and a winning culture that celebrates progress.

topics.title: Perks vs performance: the avocado toast story
topics.summary: Alisa begins an example about a leader using perks and social rituals (e.g., avocado toast) to boost morale, setting up a contrast between feel-good culture and execution/results.
